title: Spain and Italy Play for the Davis Cup Trophy
summary: Spain has reached the Davis Cup final for the first time in six years by beating Germany in a close match. They won the deciding doubles game with players Marcel Granollers and Pedro Martinez. Earlier, Pablo Carreno Busta won his singles match for Spain, but Alexander Zverev won for Germany, making it a tie. Spain has won the Davis Cup six times before and hopes to win again. They will play against Italy in the final on Sunday in Bologna, Italy. Italy is the defending champion and also has some top players missing due to injury. Both teams are excited and ready to compete for the trophy.

background_read: The Davis Cup is an international tennis tournament where teams from different countries compete. It started in 1900 and is very popular. Players represent their countries, and matches include singles and doubles games. Winning the Davis Cup is a big honor for any nation. Spain has a strong history in tennis, having won the cup multiple times. Injuries can affect teams, as top players might not be able to play. The final is the last match to decide the champion.
Article_Structure: WHO: Spain and Italy are the teams playing in the final, with players like Pablo Carreno Busta and Marcel Granollers for Spain, and Italy as the defending champion.
WHAT: Spain beat Germany in a close match to reach the Davis Cup final and will face Italy for the title.
WHERE: The final will be held in Bologna, Italy.
WHY: Both teams are competing to win the Davis Cup trophy, with Spain aiming for their seventh win and Italy defending their title.
